meanings.definition: The state or condition of being unfavorable or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The disadvantageousnesses of the storm caused damage to the crops.
meanings.sent2: The team considered the disadvantageousnesses of playing in the rain.
meanings.sent3: Despite the disadvantageousnesses of the situation, they managed to find a solution.
meanings.sent4: The disadvantageousnesses of the rocky terrain made hiking difficult.
meanings.sent5: The disadvantageousnesses of procrastination became evident when the deadline approached.

meanings.definition: The quality of being detrimental or disadvantageous.
meanings.sent1: She realized the disadvantageousnesses of skipping breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The disadvantageousnesses of the decision became apparent later.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity led to some comical disadvantageousnesses.
meanings.sent4: The disadvantageousnesses of the toxic relationship were finally acknowledged.
meanings.sent5: The disadvantageousnesses of the old car were becoming more noticeable.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being disadvantageous or detrimental.
meanings.sent1: The disadvantageousnesses of overthinking can hinder progress.
meanings.sent2: His speech highlighted the disadvantageousnesses of pollution on health.
meanings.sent3: The clown's antics added an element of playful disadvantageousnesses to the party.
meanings.sent4: The disadvantageousnesses of the faulty equipment were causing delays.
meanings.sent5: The disadvantageousnesses of the outdated software were affecting productivity.
